storyInfo: The precise nature of Mansfield and its background shakes Silence, who asks Mayer to proceed with the story she has been telling Muelsyse on her behalf.

attributes.content: Robin's not a professional assassin?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Not at all.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Even I could tell that much. She had none of the air about her.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Looks like the material I had on her was correct. She really was a security worker. Her skills certainly should've invited trust.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: But this all smacks of a little weirdness to me...
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Why they hire her is my question... but that's not too important. Skip it for now.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: More importantly, it seems most of the assassins were like Robin in that they'd been hired solo.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: They had no idea if they had any competition, and no clue who their employer was.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: How many assassins did HydeBro hire, in the end?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Your guess is as good as mine.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: But just like I said before, the Bros paid big to get rid of Anthony. Money with their blood and sweat in it.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: How did the assassins get into the prison?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: I'm sure you looked into it beforehand, tooâ€”Mansfield State Prison was established jointly by a few of the state's municipal governments, and it stands alone.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Mm. The way I've seen it described, the founding intent of the prison was to serve its state breaking new ground. Development was rapid, but crime rates stayed high, and rampant.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: So at the time, it was a half-abandoned industrial platform.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: It was Randal, the current warden, who suggested establishing the prison to the city governments. All at once, they had a solution for what to do with the platform, and where to put inmates.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Any questions so far?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Isn't the answer pretty obvious, though?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: The idea is the prison gets used as a lockbox to shove every 'troublesome' person. And it's the people none of the cities want to bother with.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Getting inside isn't the tough part.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Ms. Kafka never told you how exactly she got in there, am I right?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Of course, the prison is still a prison. Getting out is tough.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Like I said, it only visits cities on the edge once every few months. The rest of the time, it stops in the barrens.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: A convict escapes out there, they're stuck in the endless barrens until they die.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Here's the thing. Robin mentioned it. A mysterious person promised it. There was a way to get them out for sure.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: So as long as they didn't slip up and get themselves killed in there, AND successfully ran the hit on Anthony, then they'd just need to wait for extraction.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: But they sent in a lot of other assassins. Would HydeBro really be able to retrieve each and every one?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Of course not.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Which is why I said none of them knew about the others.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: And once they were inside, even if they figured it out, there'd be no escape. Their only option would be to kill Anthony or die trying.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: It's a simple, effective method.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: But I still don't understandâ€”why?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Simon Co. had shut down. Its core members were all in prison. HydeBro never once touched them. Why move against Anthony alone, of all people?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Oh. Do I actually have to start from there?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Alright, Ms. Silence, now I know you really didn't care much about this in the past.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Buuut, maybe you pulled something so bold and brashâ€”and succeededâ€”precisely because you didn't realize.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Sorry, sorry, I'm not making fun of you here. In fact, you can take it as me complimenting you.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Right, as for your question, first of all, let me answer it with a questionâ€”
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Ms. Silence, have you ever thought about how if you wanted to dispose of Anthony in prison, assassins are actually one of the least efficient methods?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Because there are much better ways. Buying off the jailers, maybe bribing the warden...
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: But sending an assassin to dress up as a prisoner, get into prison and kill another prisoner... when you hear it out loud, it sounds dumb, doesn't it?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Because they... couldn't?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Yep, because they couldn't.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Whoo, from the way you reacted to this prison's history just now, I'm gonna need to give you a walkthrough of this side from the top, Ms. Silence.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Do you still remember Kafka recalling the prison's Superintendent Barton? What did he say?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: We are Mansfield State Prison. State! Prison. We are a pilot penitentiary with special approval from the capital. We will serve as a shining example to the other states.
attributes.name: Barton

attributes.content: What about it?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Pilot. Special approval. You know what that implies?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: It implies business.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: In Columbia, the most profitable business is wherever the power is. This prison's a model case.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: What are you...?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: I'm telling you this prison is in fact Warden Randal's money machine.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: But it's a prison!
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Sure is. A heavily guarded prison. Send whoever you don't like in there for a fate worse than death. Send whoever you wanna safeguard in there to be protected.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Whatever you need, as long as you have the money.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Don't you go 'wow, that's a super-sized business opportunity?'
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: But in that case... could HydeBro not just pay the warden the requisite amount, and he'd help them do their work?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: One second you're stunned beyond belief hearing it, the next you force yourself to switch lanes and rail your thought in full steam.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: You really are amazing, Ms. Silence.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: I don't feel like you're complimenting me.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Your query's totally reasonable, but truth is I don't have a clear-cut answer either.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: But we can work backwardsâ€”in conclusion, they didn't do that. And surely they tried it before. So the only possible answer is they failed.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Personally, I think it's because the warden didn't want to get himself stuck between a rock and a hard place.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Or perhaps Anthony's mistreatment could be bought, but Anthony also had a massive influence in the prison. If he died, you sure couldn't handle it like a typical prisoner death.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: A lot of people'd love Randal's position, and as far as I know, he's got major guile too. I don't think he'd take the risk.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Someone like him? It's more likely he took HydeBro's money and just did nothing.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: I remember Anthony once saying he'd fled to Ironforge City before he was finally arrested...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Perhaps his father had some involvement in the affair?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Hmm. Yeah, that's possible as well.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Ol' Smith used to be a fair household name in Bunkerhill City. Sending his son to prison for his protection wouldn't surprise me one bit.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: But that doesn't answer my question.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: I've already answered it, Ms. Silence. You're smart. You just don't want to believe it.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: ...I don't understand.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: What I mean is they couldn't do it in Mansfield State Prison, but that doesn't mean they couldn't do it in Bunkerhill City Prison.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Wait, you don't mean his family...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Looks like you finally understand, Ms. Silence.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: You said that HydeBro never touched Anthony's family. That's a faulty assumption.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: The only reason they're not dead is because they don't need to be.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Maybe you just can't comprehend it, but in Columbia, death's far from the worst thing that could happen to a person.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Moreover, after dealing with Simon Co., HydeBro had no competitors left. They obviously wouldn't ever let the Simon family turn their next page.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: They said as much, the Simons posed no more threat...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: So once they discovered Anthony was in a prison they had no influence over, they decided Anthony was a threat?!
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Correct. As long as Anthony lives, they always face the risk of a comeback.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: So. HydeBro had a grip over their local lockup, but none at all on the prison a couple states over, Mansfield State Prison.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: No. Wait! They're a business! Even if our Energy Section is backing them, what in the world gives them any say in the local prison?!
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Well? What in the world, indeed?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: You'reâ€”you're notâ€”no, I refuse to...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Dinner's ready. Eat something, you guys.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Eep. You look like you've seen a ghost, Silence.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: I need a moment to cool my head... Mayer, if I could trouble you to continue explaining the events to Director Muelsyse.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Hmuh? Sure thing~
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Silence, you wanna eat on the side and listen?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: No, I need somewhere a little quieter.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: You can head into the kitchen, then. There's a table there.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Right. Thank you.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Okay, so where did you leave off?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: We finished Robin's past and what she was doing in the prison.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Ah, I got it. Then next should be her first failed hit...
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Uh, or from Kafka's perspective, her successfully getting in touch with Anthony.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Wow, so this is when the two of them cross paths?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Mmyup.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Let me guessy-guess. Robin's thing about entering C-Zone for cleaning.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: It's that, right?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Mm-hm. Kafka went for it, too.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: I imagine she heard it was the safest way to meet Anthony.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Ahah. Now that's straight to the punch. I like it~
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: All the middle stuff's pretty nothing. You wanna hear it?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Mmm... I'd be lying if I said I wasn't intrigued. I feel like I'd hear some pretty interesting things. But let's stick to the jailbreak itself first.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: So you wanna hear Kafka or Robin's side?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: I'll keep wiiiith Robin's.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Cool. It was a whole month since she went inside, then.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: All the while, she kept her head down and worked. Finally clawed out the chance to go to C-Zone for cleaning.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Used every material at her disposal, made all the weapons she could count on. Packed them on her person.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Sounds like she was pretty amply prepared. Did she get sussed by Anthony, then? Or stopped by Kafka?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Nope. Something wild happened.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: All present?
attributes.name: Jailer A

attributes.content: Here.
attributes.name: A-Zone Prisoners

attributes.content: Here.
attributes.name: B-Zone Prisoners

attributes.content: Here~
attributes.name: Kafka

attributes.content: (Hey, you're fresh meat too, right? I've seen you before at the factory.)
attributes.name: Kafka

attributes.content: Listen up. You've got new inmates among you, so I'll repeat the rules.
attributes.name: Jailer A

attributes.content: A-Zone and B-Zone are responsible for different rooms. The two of us will take you separately.
attributes.name: Jailer A

attributes.content: But you will all get one turn cleaning up Mr. Anthony's room.
attributes.name: Jailer A

attributes.content: Heheh. Why's that?
attributes.name: B-Zone Prisoner A

attributes.content: It's called respect. You understand?
attributes.name: Jailer A

attributes.content: ...A-Zone with me, B-Zone with him.
attributes.name: Jailer B

attributes.content: I'll make it brief. Once you're in, don't touch what you shouldn't. Don't even think about taking what you shouldn't.
attributes.name: Jailer A

attributes.content: Do your work. Especially when it comes to Mr. Anthony's room. You are to clean his room like you care for your own mommy. Is that clear?
attributes.name: Jailer A

attributes.content: Heheh. Like I give a slug's ass about my mommy, hehey.
attributes.name: B-Zone Prisoner A

attributes.content: You, shut it. I'm saying this for the first-timers here. Don't give me trouble, you hear me?
attributes.name: Jailer A

attributes.content: I got it, I got it.
attributes.name: B-Zone Prisoner A

attributes.content: Behave, and we'll give you some playtime in an empty C-cell.
attributes.name: Jailer A

attributes.content: Whew, now that's a perk. I'll be good as a baby, then, heheh.
attributes.name: B-Zone Prisoner A

attributes.content: Enough! You all got your cleaning gear on you? If so, we'll get ready to go upstairs.
attributes.name: Jailer A

attributes.content: (So these are the C-Zone cells... I've finally gotten in.)
attributes.name: Robin

attributes.content: (Every story has four cells. Each cell only links to the elevator.)
attributes.name: Robin

attributes.content: (But the style of these cells is so different to ours. It feels like... there's no privacy at all here.)
attributes.name: Robin

attributes.content: Get down to it. Stop gawking around.
attributes.name: Jailer B

attributes.content: Over here is Anthony's... Mr. Anthony's room.
attributes.name: Jailer B

attributes.content: Looks like the other side's there already.
attributes.name: Jailer B

attributes.content: Just get in there and clean up. Don't think about brawling with B-Zone here.
attributes.name: Jailer B

attributes.content: I'll be watching you.
attributes.name: Jailer B

attributes.content: (This jailer's not like the others. Real domineering...)
attributes.name: Robin

attributes.content: (Focus. I finally get to see Anthony.)
attributes.name: Robin

attributes.content: (In all the photos, he's built crazy strong. If I took him on directly, I'd have no chance of winning.)
attributes.name: Robin

attributes.content: (But no matter how strong the person, as long as you can find a weak point, there's a chance...)
attributes.name: Robin

attributes.content: (Just clean up while you look for it. Even if finding a weak point's all I get, I'll take it.)
attributes.name: Robin

attributes.content: (Pop, protect me.)
attributes.name: Robin

attributes.content: Hm? What's going on?
attributes.name: Jailer B

attributes.content: (A jailer and a few B-Zoners got taken out.)
attributes.name: Robin

attributes.content: Who are you? Why kill me?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: You don't need to know who wants you dead, Mr. Anthony.
attributes.name: B-Zone Prisoner A

attributes.content: All you need to know is this is where you die. Heheh.
attributes.name: B-Zone Prisoner A

attributes.content: Boss, the A-Zone team's here.
attributes.name: B-Zone Prisoner B

attributes.content: Came fast, heheh.
attributes.name: B-Zone Prisoner A

attributes.content: No problem. Bud, you take that batch out.
attributes.name: B-Zone Prisoner A

attributes.content: Don't go killin' now. We still gotta get outta here, heheh.
attributes.name: B-Zone Prisoner A

attributes.content: (No way. They're here to take out Anthony too...)
attributes.name: Robin

attributes.content: Whyn'tcha take this!
attributes.name: Kafka

attributes.content: Get outta my way, brat!
attributes.name: B-Zone Prisoner A

attributes.content: Gah!
attributes.name: Kafka

attributes.content: (He knocked that girl stupid in one punch too...)
attributes.name: Robin

attributes.content: Heh.
attributes.name: Jailer B

attributes.content: (Huh. Did that jailer smirk just now...?)
attributes.name: Robin

attributes.content: (Ugh, now's not the time to worry. This one's coming for me. I gotta deal with him first!)
attributes.name: Robin
